networking

Class DataPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • networking.DataPacket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigPacket

    public class DataPacket
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will form objects that form packets to be sent over UDP. There are two constructors: One constructor takes all header fields and the data. The other constructor takes the raw packet.
    Since:
    2014-04-08
    Version:
    1.0-b
    Author:
    Sander Koning

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataPacket

        protected DataPacket()

      • DataPacket

        public DataPacket(byte[] raw)
           throws DatagramDataSizeException
        Construct DataPacket from raw data received over a link
        Parameters:
        raw - Raw packet data (including headers)
        Throws:
        DatagramDataSizeException

      • DataPacket

        public DataPacket(byte source,
          byte destination,
          byte hops,
          byte sequencenr,
          byte[] data,
          java.lang.Boolean ack,
          java.lang.Boolean routing,
          java.lang.Boolean keepalive,
          java.lang.Boolean more)
           throws DatagramDataSizeException
        Build packet from scratch.
        Parameters:
        source - The source
        destination - The destination
        hops - Number of hops
        sequencenr - Sequencenumber to identify packets
        data - Array of bytes with raw data, cannot exceed size 1024-HEADER_SIZE
        ack - The packet is an ack
        routing - The packet is meant for routing
        keepalive - The packet is a keep alive signal
        more - Should be set if the packet with sequencenumber + 1 is part of this packet
        Throws:
        DatagramDataSizeException
